Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Pet Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Lora B
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for visiting many different areas in Miami. We went during peak time and found not staying on the beach helped us save $$. We had two well behaved dogs (large) and there is a nice play area behind the furthest building near the McDonalds. The sidewalks are limited for walking dogs as it's near the airport but there are several dog parks in Miami to help exercise your dogs. This location was within walking distance to Mcdonalds, Wendys, Subway and Denny's. The hotel also offers a breakfast (oatmeal, bread, fruit, coffee etc.) but arrive early in the AM as it can get extremely busy. The pool was basic but was used frequently by guests and us. TVs in the room are awesome and so are the nice comfy beds. I would highly recommend this hotel. It's literally 10-15 min from all major things in Miami. Loved it and the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Carpet needs cleaning and free breakfeast was a joke!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravel4fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a night before we flew home .The room appeared neat and clean but when we took off our shoes and started to walk around we noticed our feet were getting dirty.The room was was nice otherwise. Bed was comfortable .Bathroom was a bit old looking but was clean and fine. Staff were frendly . My biggest complaint was the Free breakfast! There was nothing to it. Juice ,Coffee that was empty and not refilled . A few choices of : toast ,bagels.waffle ,toast , branflakes and an apple or orange. There was no attendant making sure this was refilled at all. Needless to say we had to go to IHOP and spend another $25. So factor that in when you look at the room rate if you want the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “My mistake, but not dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: pmatawan
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the LaQuinta East previously, I thought that I had again booked the same hotel, but upon arrival, I realized that I had booked LaQuinta NORTH instead. Not as nice a property, but they provide free parking also, so I decided to stay. The hotel is definately ready for a renovation. What I did like about this hotel is the dining choiced within walking distance. Sandwiched between a McDonalds and a Wendys, there are 5 sit down restaurants in the shopping plaza next store.

Reviews.Title: “bring earplugs and keep your shoes on”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind sleeping in the airport hanger, go for it. Really wonder if the rugs ever get vacuumed and other floors ever get mopped. Have stayed at many La Quintas over the years and believe this one could be the company example of how to drive customers to other motel chains. Shame on you La Quinta...

Reviews.Title: “OK, as a last (or almost last) choice”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaEagerEater
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel as a money saver. While the rooms were clean, the parking lot, sidewalks, and stairways were filthy. The 'continental' breakfast is very spartan, mostly sugary, and served in a very tiny lobby; you'll be rubbin' elbows with your fellow guests. I have not stayed in a LaQuinta in some time but thought they enjoyed a sort of mid-value status. Not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: marybontempo
Reviews.Content: Smelled fresh, not like chemicals. Nice furniture and decor. Clean. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Someone plung the toliet please.!!!”
Reviews.Author: Treeer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a night be4 our departure the next morning going to the port of mia. So when we arrived the room was neat & clean. Not the greatest area. But our complaint was not the thin walls or the noisy planes passing over, but the toilet. Yes,it started wit the water going down slowly when flushed.then the nite-mare began. It started over flowing. It seemed as tho it was a never ending gross mess. This was near 1:00am in the morning! We was so tired by this time. Since it hadn't flowed onto the floor, we turned the lights off an went to bed. The stay would have been ok if this wouldn't have happened.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: MSRussell
Reviews.Content: The only problem I had, was I was booked in the furthest building. Will make it a hassle wheeling my two pieces of luggage to the lobby. That is the only problem I found. There is a Dennys nearby, plus fast food places, all within walking distance. Taking a cruise in a few hrs. the shuttle is an independent company, so it cost $10.00 for it, well worth it to me. Shuttle is free from the airport, when I called, he was there already, but not where I was. The clerk called him, and he swung around to pick me up. From what I see, the pop in the machine is $1.25 for bottle, am going to pick up 2 or three for the ship. A hint...if you are a coffee drinker, there is only one packet of coffee in the room, the desk clerk will give more.

Reviews.Title: “Typical La Quinta Property”
Reviews.Author: ElPasoJack
Reviews.Content: I spent the night (actually less than 5 hrs) at this hotel as I traveled to Aruba recently. It is within 10 minutes of MIA, and I selected it for convenience. I had guaranteed reservations for a non-smoking room, but upon arrival, there were only three rooms available, all smoking. Without much choice at 1am (late arrival from DFW), I suffered through what little time I spent in the room. Otherwise, the room was in decent shape, bathroom, furnishings, and the desk clerk was friendly. As the review title states, typical La Quinta property. I'd use them again only if I knew for certain the room would be non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “fast food haven”
Reviews.Author: carribbeanmic
Reviews.Content: Room was OK, TV had peaceful sound machine. Wendy and strip mall to the left Denny's and McDonalds to the right. Good airport transfer 24 hour

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Montrealeronthemove
Reviews.Content: We went to La Quinta North Airport Miami coming back from a Transatlantic cruise and wanted a hotel with an airport shuttle. Price was an issue. I had read some of the reviews and was worried about what I would find. We got to the hotel rather early (10h30 a.m.) and naturally there were no available room yet. The reception employee Marisol was extremely nice and explained that as soon as a room became available she would let us know. About ten minutes after she called me to offer me a room. The room was standard but had all the amenities needed. The hotel could use some renovations but it was clean and although we were on the ground floor, we found no bugs, which is rare for a ground floor room in Florida. The breakfast room would need to be taken out of the main lobby because it gets really crowded. Breakfast is the standard continental and selection is good. The shuttle to the airport is effecient and the operators we had (Sebastian, Kevin) were extremely polite and helpful. There are restaurants nearby, actually right next door and on the other side there is a very small shopping strip with a couple of Cuban place which are really good and affordable. All in all, this is a very good hotel and the plus is really the staff. We appreciated being there. See photos attached. They will talk more than anything else that could be said.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a one night stay on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: MarkeyG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you are flying in or out of Miami. Not the most luxurious by any means but perfect for an overnight. The room was very clean but the bathroom had some minor issues. Try the Cuban restaurant in the shopping center next to the hotel for great food!!

Reviews.Title: “SMALL bathroom, nice beds”
Reviews.Author: bigsky55
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that the rooms were "motel" style; outdoor entrances to rooms. Not that big a deal, but I thought it was a hotel. The room was fairly small with the vanity area outside the bathroom, with flourescernt lighting that wasn't separated from the bed area, so if you turned on the light for the vanity, it shined right on the closest bed. Very small bathroom just big enough for the tub and toilet. Door cleared the toilet by 1/16". Wood or fake wood flooring in bathroom had seen better days. Beds very comfortable with nice bedspreads and smooth sheets. OK breakfast with the usual cereal, bread/bagels for toast, oranges, yogurt was nice. Good juices and coffee. They had a free airport shuttle, but we didn't need it since we had a rental car. Outdoor pool looked nice, but we didn't use it. Room fine for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Room with awful smell”
Reviews.Author: emelendez_cr
Reviews.Content: This review is about La Quinta Inn Miami Airport North at 7401 NW 36th Street. Please DON'T GO THERE. I made a reservation after reading a few good reviews of other La Quinta Inn hotels. We stayed there just for a night (we couldn't possible had stayed more than that) because we had an early flight next morning. The room smelled awful. It was like dropping 10 gallons of water on the carpet and then close the door for a year. The TV didn't worked. Actually it never turned on. The hotel was also full so there was no chance to change rooms. The only good thing was the attention of the front desk guy who BTW was the only person working at the hotel that night. He help us solved an issue with the parking and was quite busy helping other people with other kinds of problems. It's a shame he didn't work at a decent hotel. In brief a terrible experience that thanks God only lasted for a few hours, but I'm absolutely sure I'm never coming back to La Quinta. I never tought I would think that $60 per night was such a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the layover but not like pics.”
Reviews.Author: oneloveforever
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Dec 1 2011 as a layover hotel . The highlights were the breakfast and free shuttle to and from the airport. Be advised you must call the hotel upon landing to ensure pickup. The breakfast was ok but the waffles were premade and choices were mostly carbs ,coffee , and juice . The pool is outside and quite cold. The rooms are the most dated that I have stayed in . The was a fake wood floor in the bath that was buckleing . There is no mini fridge or microwave in the lower catagory rooms. There was alot of food options in walking distance. We stayed because of the price , shuttle and breakfast but do not expect the usual La Quinta look.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Inn Miami Airport North”
Reviews.Author: FabricioJimenezF
Reviews.Content: I consider this it's a nice Hotel, it has an excellent location. I totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Negatives”
Reviews.Author: muskrat2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the airport, but a fare distance by road. The airport shuttle took awhile, but after seeing the rush hour traffic, we understood why. The young man driving the van was very nice. Arriving at the hotel, the lobby was just not impressive. Very messy and not real clean looking. We had a room on the second floor--the exterior walkway was littered with cigarette butts, including one about six inches in front of our door. The parking lot was in the same condition. SWEEP UP THE BUTTS--ONCE IN A WHILE AT LEAST. The outside of the building needed maintenance--shabby. The room itself was OK. Clean enough--would easily of made a 3 had the rest of the place been similar. Free internet, but only one terminal and printer. Printing a boarding pass took awhile. Finally, and against our better jugdement, we let the front desk convince us that we needed to take the 3:45 AM shuttle to make our 6:30 AM flight. No traffic, arrived at the airport at 4:00 AM--and waited over an hour for our gate to open. Should have known better.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a night or two.”
Reviews.Author: mainegnome
Reviews.Content: The room we had was clean, comfortable and nice. The grounds are a little grubby as are the exterior of the buildings. The wifi was fine. It's location is fine for travelers to the airport, not grate for the city or the beach. The airport van runs routes only on the hour so if you want a pick up don't plan on it getting there to quickly. Good place for the money for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to La Quinta Miami Airport North”
Reviews.Author: linCostaRica
Reviews.Content: We frequently stay at this hotel when transiting in Miami and always experience a warm welcome and prompt, courteous service. Although we usually arrive on very late flights, we are picked up by the shuttle quickly. On our last visit in Oct 2011, we were upgraded to the suite...a delightful surprise. 2 large nicely decored rooms, microwave, fridge, fans, air-con. Breakfast was satisfactory, free internet is a great plus, and several restaurants just steps away make this an easy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nordest_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in November 2011. The hotel has most definitely seen better times, but the room was clean although there were stains in the bathub, carpets and walls not in great shape etc. Free Internet and complimentary breakfast a nice plus and the food court just beside the hotel is convenient if you want to grab dinner and don't have a car. Friendly staff. Free shuttle bus to the airport leaves every hour so make sure you check the timetable to avoid long waiting. A reasonably priced hotel if you are in transit and need to stay one night closed to the airport without spending a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl2585
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a overnight stay in Miami to pick up a family member. The hotel was convient for us for where we were going next day. The room was nice and big. (King Suite) Price was great! 79.00$. The road the hotel is on is very busy so be prepared for that as it is right next to interstate 75. There are several restaurants to choose from near hotel. Only complaint is the carpets stink in the hallways. Overall, good price and worth it to save a few pennies for other things:)

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl059
Reviews.Content: We only stay at this LaQuinta when we travel from the Miami airport. The shuttle to the airport is wonderful and so convenient to park our vehicle for the entire length of our trip. However, twice now when we have called upon our return to Miami for the shuttle to pick us up we have waited on the curb for a long time. In July we waited at least 45 minutes and last night we waited an hour. Had to make two calls to the front desk inquiring as to the status of our pickup. The LaQuinta West and LaQuinta East shuttles both went by twice while we were waiting for the LaQuinta North van. Also, the breakfast room is too small and too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: Grsh_11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice because they offer 24 hour shuttles to/from the airport. This is convenient for the many flights to the Caribbean and South America that require a layover in Miami. The hotel is old but has been updated and is clean and comfortable. They have an "extended" continental breakfast meaning they have quite a few choices. It is a good choice if you need to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible night”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in as part of the Choice Hotel group. It was very old and rundown. The air conditioner was very loud making sleep impossible. My non-smoking room had ash trays and match books in it and also the hallway wreaked of cigarette smoke. Breakfast area was dirty and smelly. Ahhhhhhhh !!!!! . water pressure in shower was very low its like dripping faucet.

Reviews.Title: “1 night stop - not to bad”
Reviews.Author: April W
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 1 night before boarding our cruise. It was clean & bed were comfortable. We never heard the planes go over unless we were outside. It was very cost effective. Dont plan on the breakfast. It was a bit of a disappointment. We have stayed in several La Quinta's & always had a great breakfast. This one was lacking. Very tiny space & not a lot to choose from unless your considering White or Wheat toast. Bagel or Cereal! & one of the toasters was broken so then you stood in line. There is a McDonalds & Wendys on each side so there are other possibilities. Overall - inexpensive, good night sleep & would stay again in the same situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Deymy P
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the services and the maintanance of the property. I would like to suggest that you pressure wash the property.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay not far from the airport and Dolphin Mall.”
Reviews.Author: Cindy-Rox
Reviews.Content: We usually stay here when we come to Miami for a couple of days. It is really easy to drive from this location to the beaches or the Mall. Continental breakfast is included which you know what you are going to get. Sometimes the rooms are not that clean so we have to ask front desk to come and clean it again. Staying here you know what you are going to get for the price. Also have washers and dryers and a pool and a Denny's restaurant and McDonalds's you can walk to.

Reviews.Title: “better than terrific”
Reviews.Author: frsnkmoc
Reviews.Content: thanks to all the hotel staff especially front desk she help with a quick check in thanks again keep up the great service

Reviews.Title: “Recommended If You Just Need A Bed To Sleep In”
Reviews.Author: eighthwonder
Reviews.Content: We booked this room because our flight arrived in Miami late at night and we wanted something basic and near the airport. They have a free shuttle to and from the airport, which was convenient. We called for the shuttle after we picked up our luggage and only waited about 15 minutes for the van to arrive. All of the employees were friendly and helpful; the housekeeping staff all smiled and greeted you when you walked by and the front desk staff were all very nice and courteous. It is a motel, so there were only two levels and there were several different buildings. Our room was in a far building, so we had to exit the reception building and walk outside to our building, where we could take an elevator up. It wasn't that bad at all, but it would probably be frustrating if you had heavy baggage or if it were raining. Our room was neat and clean, and it was pretty large. We had a very large flat screen tv in our room, an area for seating, and a desk. There was a medium sized closet with luggage racks, hanging space, and a safe. We also had a coffee station in our room. The bed was EXTREMELY comfortable, which was a nice surprise and helped us sleep off our jet-lag. Breakfast was dissapointing. It was free, so I guess I can't complain much, but there were only bagels, white and wheat bread, muffins, two types of dry cereal, apples and oranges, and few types of jam. We didn't bother with the toaster because the line was so long. They were out of spoons when we got there, and the front desk said that they didn't have any more, which was dissapointing because we had already prepared cereal with milk. They had one or two types of juice, but they were from concentrate and tasted cheap. The dining area was also far too small to accomodate all of their guests. There were some small tables across from the reception desk, but they were all full, and several guests were standing and eating. There wasn't room for us to even stand and eat because it was so crowed, so we ended up bringing it all back to our room. There are a few fast food restaurants next to the motel; I would recommend just going there instead if you want a decent breakfast. Ultimately, I would recommend this motel for stop-overs or for people who want to save a lot of money on lodging. The location was pretty far from all of the tourist sights in Miami, so I wouldn't stay there for a vacation, but there were several vacationing families staying there when we were there, so I guess that you could make it work by taking a taxi or shuttle to downtown and the beaches. The price is great for the area, so as long as you don't expect luxury you should be happy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy to get to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: maryIL
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel whenever we have an early flight out of MIA. The staff is great, free breakfast and shuttle to the airport. There is a strip mall next door with several good ethnic restaurants, that we have dinner at the night we stay.

Reviews.Title: “good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: sarita555
Reviews.Content: A good deal for the price. Clean room, friendly service, quite close to the airport. We missed the breakfast by getting up too late but there is a small supermarket in a small shopping centre where you can buy fruit, yogurt etc. about five minutes walk from the hotel (turn left). Shopping centre also had a really good (and cheap) Cuban (?) restuarant. Only problem was getting the transport from the airport to the hotel. It was very difficult to find the number but one of the tourist guides helped us out.

Reviews.Title: “Its dirt cheap for a reason.”
Reviews.Author: megan00412
Reviews.Content: For 500 dollars with 6 night, I suppose you should not expect any type of luxury. However, having just the basics would have been nice. Perhaps a toilet that flushed, more than one light that worked. There was a chair with a stain I feel unnecessary to describe. Tiny ants made their way to the ceiling, the iron stained my clothes, room key advertises to a place that no longer delivers to the hotel, holes in the wall, and if you're staying with more than one person you better hope they don't want any drawer space. This is a star and a half hotel, that is not actually near any of the places it claims to be. Save money on gas and cabs, and just spend the extra dollar on South beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: queenk67
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect for an $80 a night hotel, but we were surprised. The shuttle promptly picked us up at the airport and the driver (I think his name was Sergio) was very friendly. The room was very clean and quiet. We signed up for the $20 shuttle to take us to the Port the next morning, but we were the only two, so the hotel paid the difference and called us a taxi instead. Saved us $20. Didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as there were too many people and not enough places to sit. That was fine because we just walked to McDonald's next door. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value near MIA Airport. Near several restaurants”
Reviews.Author: randyr1944
Reviews.Content: Good place to saty when transiting MIA airport. Shopping center next door offers several very good restaurants with a large variety of food.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a quick layover”
Reviews.Author: Lov_2_travel_10
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a lot of La Quintas and this one could definitely use some upgrades / renovations, but for a quick one night stay it was fine. We were disappointed that the breakfast did not have many options, especially in comparison to other La Quintas that offer hot options. Also, looking at the map we thought it was pretty close to the airport, but it was a long shuttle ride and there are many options that are closer to the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Possible bed bugs?”
Reviews.Author: Jasminejeopardy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the La Quinta North in Miami after a missions trip to Haiti. I stayed in Haiti for a whole week and didn't have any itching the whole time I was there except for an incidence with some red ants the first night. When my roommate and I stayed at the La Quinta, we noticed that our room smelled as if it had just been cleaned very thoroughly, and the rest of our groups rooms did not. We thought that we were lucky, but now I wonder if we picked up bed bugs from there because a few days after returning home I noticed I was getting bite marks, like mosquito bites, on my arm. I have not found any of the bugs yet but it is not looking promising on my arms. I got to say that compared to the hard pillows we had in Haiti, the bed at La Quinta was very comfortable, but unfortunately with some unwanted guests. The shuttle was slow, and did not have enough room for all of us, but they did allow for us to take a taxi and get reimbursed for that. A great Cuban restuarant was within walking distance from the hotel, along with other fast food options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: TeresaSammis
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been renovated since earlier reviews here. Our room was immaculate and nicely appointed. The lobby was also very nice. Our shuttle driver was very friendly and prompt on picking us up at the airport when we called. We took an early morning shuttle the next day and that went well too. We left too early to try the continental breakfast. Our coffee pot in the room, was extremely slow...after an hour still hadn't made 4 cups...a drop at a time. I did report it on my review form. We did try out the Cuban Restaurant next door, El Tropico. Here's a hint. Order one meal and split. It was excellent but huge, huge portions. Really good though. And there's a Denny's, McDonald's etc within walking distance (as in yards away).

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: kwluann
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at La Quinta's in the past and have been very satisfied. This one is at the bottom of the rung. The rooms are okay but the continental breakfast is bare minimum. If you stay more than one day the room service consists of making your bed and replacing towels (maybe-other members of our party didn't even have their room touched). No trash removal or cleaning of sinks or tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Pdxtender
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night before a cruise. We are from the west coast and got in to town at night so we didn't need a spendy place at the beach. Got the shuttle just fine,check in was quick then we went to the strip mall next door for some great cuban food. We did notice that our smoking room did not have ashtrays so we stopped by the front desk on our way back from dinner. When we checked in there were 2 clerks and the front desk now only one. He helped me quickly told him what I needed and he told me it would be just a minute since they were in a closet across the way. That would have been fine except for the group of people that were hanging out in the lobby pestering the poor guy. Can I have a free toothbrush or 5 of them? Do you have a hot tub,spa sauna? What time does the pool close? Do you have free breakfast? Oh great I will call you and tell you what I want and you can bring it to me. These are the real questions I heard while I waited. The security gaurd had to ask the group to quite down at least 2 times and a few got really nasty with her. The phone was ringing with people wanting the shuttle. This group just kept on talking to him while he was on the phone trying to take care of things. And the clerk was very great the whole time. I work in customer service and I am not sure I would have been that nice to all of them my self. I never got the ashtrays since I had been waiting for over half an hour. Not the clerks fault he was not given a minute to breath. The security gaurd was great and I told her so.I did get a few bowls from the breakfast area and used those. I was told that was Ok and it was ok with me too. Now the shuttle to the Port of Miami we did not take the hotel approved one. THe only spots left when we checked in were for the 1pm and we wanted to be there before that. Our plan was to take the hotel shuttle to the airport and take a $24 cab to the port. But we got lucky. A shuttle pulled up and we asked if there was room for 2 more. Yep. Lucky for us another guest felt that the 1 pm shuttle was too late for them too and made arangements for the one we were on. I guess the hotel approved shuttles do not start until 11am. The only thing I did not like was a group got on our shuttle thinking it was the hotel approved one. A staff member (who I had not seen when I had checked out) ran up to the van and was very clear that this was not a HOTEL APPROVED SHUTTLE and if anyone had paid the hotel they needed to wait for the REAL shuttle. So out they went and we had to wait to unload their luggage. Too bad seemed like nice folks too. As I was telling my husband about the motley crew in the lobby I told him "i sure hope they are not on our cruie." You guessed it They were. Thankfully I already knew their game and faces and was able to stay far far away.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good!”
Reviews.Author: jkbtravelers
Reviews.Content: We opted to stay at this hotel based on other travelers comments that is was ok for a one night layover. Unfortunately I have to disagree. It took over 45 minutes for the shuttle driver to pick us up at the Airport, which is too long. We saw other hotels pass through 2 or 3 times in that time frame. The hotel room was not clean, carpet was stained and paint was chipped. The biggest problem however came in the morning. We had to catch the 8:00 am shuttle to make our flight. Went to take a shower and turned on the hot water and nothing came out. Called the desk and were told there were no other rooms available, so no showers for us. I will say the desk clerk was nice about it and ended up comping our room. But I would suggest staying elsewhere, even if it is only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Isopor
Reviews.Content: We needed a room to stay overnight and get to plane the next morning. The check in and out was quick. The motel parking style was a plus for us, because we parked the car close to the room, and it was easy and quick to move the bags. The room was a bit ugly and old style, but it was clean and well equipped. We liked the coffee maker because we had to leave early before the hotel breakfast (6am onwards; 7am onwards on weekends). The double room was too small for us (1,40m), but the bed was confortable. I can't judge the noise issue. I heard airplanes until midnight but fell asleep afterwards. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short Stay”
Reviews.Author: FNOBRAZIL
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice to be close to the airport easy to reach the most important points of Miami. Nice breakfast, although, you have to be patient....space and equipments are not enough and sometims you take a lot of time to toast your bread..... Staff so friendly! My room was spacious, clean and quiet . I recommend for a short stay, with limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you missed your flight and have to sleep in Miami”
Reviews.Author: PRG1965
Reviews.Content: We lost our connection to DC due to the weather and we had to sleep at this Miami airport hotel for one night. I guess it's okay for an emergency, but I will not stay there for vacations. The staff was friendly and there is a very convenient 24 hour free shuttle to and from the airport (but only once every hour so you better check with the hotel the time table). When our shuttle came to take us to the hotel, there was not enough room for us (family of four with suitcases). The driver told us to take a taxi, ask for a receipt and then get a reimbursement at the front desk. It worked perfectly. The beds are small for two people, and the location is just what you can expect near the airport. There are fast food restaurants nearby but we asked for "room service": it was extremely generous but it took almost an hour. The hotel is okay, but I will use it only in an emergency like ours.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good one for a short stay...”
Reviews.Author: baknedicem
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a day after a cruise in December 2010. Although it is a little far from the downtown and Miami beach, it is a lovely hotel to stay. It has nice, clean rooms. Nice and friendly people are working there. The front desk was helpful, it is just minutes away from the airport. It has also free parking. If you are not Floridan and do not have a SunPass for the toll roads, it may be a problem to go to downtown from the hotel. It takes like 12 to 15 miles to go to downtown or Miami beach because downtown bound roads are tolled and accepts only SunPass so you need to follow a different route. But airport bound roads are toll free. Breakfast was ok but the lounge is very narrow and small that you wait in a long queue to get some breakfast. I waited 20 minutes in line and when I get there, everything was finished, even hot water for tea. Also there are just 3-4 tables so people bring breakfast to their rooms. There are coffee makers in the rooms though. All in all I would recommend this hotel for short stays and if you need a hotel close to airport, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MiriamBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night. It was perfect. It was clean, very close restaurants, free internet wifi in the room and free shuttle to the airport and a very good free breakfast. The staff was very polite. They do all they promise. I will be back without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Cheap Price!”
Reviews.Author: Steph2DJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to cruise guests. My boyfriend and I stayed here the night before we left for a cruise and everything worked out perfectly. There is a Wendy's right next store if you are hungry. There is also a shopping plaza with a dollar store and a liquor store and much more. The cruise shuttle was only $10 per person and that is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Best economy facility near airport”
Reviews.Author: kissinkousin
Reviews.Content: I take church mission trip groups at various times to destinations in Latin America. My need is for a econony priced good facility in Miami that offers an airport shuttle. This year after searching online I found LaQuinta Inn Airport North. In various facilities in which we have stayed this facility rates as THE BEST. This facility offered everything we were looking for and exceeded my expecations. Most economy priced facilities are just acceptable but this facility far exceeded that. It is the nicest we have stayed in for the price. Not only was it clean and close to good places to eat but your staff was EXCEPTIONAL. Our trip to Brazil necessitated a stay in Miami on both ends of our trip. Sept 4 and 20. so we experienced both the daytime staff and the night staff. DANIEL on the front desk was very friendly and helpful on checkin and I can't say enough about SERGIO the van driver. Our team members came in from various places at various times, some delayed due to a rainstorm, and he went beyond the call of duty to make sure everyone was picked up at the airport in a timely manner. On previous trips I have not experienced hotel staff as concerned and friendly as your staff. Every effort was made to be very friendly and please us in our accomodations. I just want to spread the word about this great facility. You can be sure the next time I need accomodations for my groups this facility will be the first place I look!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't actually stay here, but I was glad”
Reviews.Author: ysnkaren
Reviews.Content: I made a huge mistake that I was grateful for in the end. My husband and I made a late evening trip to Miami to take our son back to school. I made a last minute reseravation at this motel because we wanted someplace cheap where we could have our small dog. When we showed up very late, it turned out I had made the reservation for the wrong night. I was glad though, because this place just looked seedy and dirty. The lobby seemed nasty and I was really surprised that they didn't have any vacant rooms. And when I called the La Quinta West nearby, I was quoted a price of $99, even though I had seen the rooms on the web that afternoon for $65.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: ca4cha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight while waiting for an international flight out of Miami the next day. They have a 24 hour shuttle service which picked us up at the airport, and dropped us back off the next day. There is a McDonald's next door, and a Denny's next to that. The room was clean and just ok.There is nothing to do within walking distance, but it is convenient to the airport. It worked fine for an overnight, but I would not recommend it for more than that. There is a minimal free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate stay for one night!”
Reviews.Author: BGIWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: So after deep research I chose this property to overnight on a connection at MIA on May 27th, 2010. I was initially going with Miami Airport East, but then I got a $49 deal on www.aa.com/hotel. When I arrived at MIA after 6pm I called reception to get the location of the shuttle. I was informed it left the airport already and I was authorised to take a taxi and I would be refunded. The refund was promptly made upon my arrival. Check-in was smooth. I got the room I requested on the 3rd floor. The room was basic, nice cable selection and clean bed/bathroom. I really can't complain about anything at this hotel. Breakfast the next morning was basic continental fare. Muffins, bagels, juices, teas, cereals, fruits, milk and water I recall. Since I had to take the 6am shuttle, I just grabbed a couple muffins. The shuttle left promptly at 6am. The ride from MIA to the hotel was 15 mins, the return journey was 10 mins. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a overnight stay in Miami. There's a number of fast food joints around the property as well.

Reviews.Title: “An OK place to stay for one night”
Reviews.Author: BigDiverChris
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel during the evening prior to flying out of Miami. The hotel was OK for just crashing for the evening. The only disappointment was that they placed us in a smoking room, even though I reserved a non-smoking room. When I mentioned it to the front desk, I was told that no one had annotated my reservation for a non-smoking room. I thought when I reserved a non-smoking room that I would automatically get one. It was not a big deal because the room did not have any significant smoke odor, except in the closet that we didn't use. If you are allergic to cigarette smoke, I would recommend calling the hotel ahead of time to confirm that they have you booked in a non-smoking room. While the hotel a bit older, the room was reasonably clean. We arrived late in the evening and left early the next morning. The beds are older spring mattresses that were firm and not very comfortable (though I have slept on worse). The breakfast was simple, cereals, bagels, and juice...nothing to write home about. The main reason that I chose this hotel is that it offers inexpensive accommodations and they provide free parking while we are on our trip. Also, they offer wireless high-speed internet access, which worked well. While I probably would not recommend this hotel for a long-term vacation stay, it's a good bargain hotel near the airport that provides free parking, shuttles, and high-speed internet. With these amenities, it pretty much pays for itself if you are staying for just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre-Cruise stopover!”
Reviews.Author: dancinghorse
Reviews.Content: We chose this La Quinta because it had the lowest price, had a free airport shuttle, pool and free breakfast. We just wanted an affordable place to stay the night before our cruise. The shuttle picked us up, staff was extremely helpful and friendly, rooms were adequate for our needs and the pool was nice. The location was very convenient to a Liquor store, convenience store and restaurants which are right next to the hotel on the same side of the street. We were grateful for the free breakfast but found that the items were pretty basic (apples, packaged muffins, bread) and the lineup for the coffee was so crowded it was blocking the exit/entrance to the lobby. We got the pre-arranged shuttle to the Port of Miami ($40 for 4 of us) it was reasonable and fine. We had a choice of different times to depart as well which I did not expect, so we got to the Port at the time we wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: hppytraveler62
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at this hotel as well as others in the Miami area. This is probably one of the best deals you can get around the airport. The staff has always been friendly and very helpful, the rooms have been fine, and you don't get nickled and dimed! The floors are gross (dirty feet if barefoot) but it is outdoor entry and high-volume. Other than that, the rooms are clean and quiet. If you are looking for a cheap, comfortable place to stay then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mizamazon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stayed. It was quiet, the staff was pleasant, room were nice and clean. My kids loved it and enjoyed the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Black socks and stolen items.....”
Reviews.Author: sportsmom1988
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK at best. Has a musty smell and our socks were black from walking in the room after only a few minutes. Location is good if you like fast food and more fast food. Here's the really bad thing. My son left his baseball team sweatshirt folded up under his pillow because the pillows weren't great and he needed more support. Unfortunatly, he left it behind when we checked out. We left on a cruise but we realized the sweatshirt was gone right away. When we got back into port we called right away. Left three messages and no one called us back until I called the corporate office. After 5 days they called and claimed it was never found. WHAT LIARS!!!!! We are 100 percent sure the sweatshirt was left under the pillow and unless they don't change the linens, they found it and kept it. So, DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. They are thieves.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: SouthernRNR
Reviews.Content: I travel through Miami several times a year and need an overnight stay. La Quinta seems to be the best overall deal. It's clean, neat, the people are friendly and it's relatively inexpensive. I suppose for all you Lindsey Lohan, "Oh! I can't stand coach, get me out of here (stomp, stomp, stomp)" people it might not be good enough; but for others, it's just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: mbarder
Reviews.Content: I was there for one night. I arrived from Brazil at night and went to Orlando. We arrived at hotel 09:00PM and leave 08:30AM. The people was very nice. The room was clear and there was a bootle of water and a cookie wating for us. The Free Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sugarbrat
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very clean. The rate was great and the location better for my purposes of visiting family due to a family death. The staff was friendly. Breakfast was available, however there is a McDs and a Wendys right next to the property. Very convienent. There have been other reviews that I have read that state the area is run down but to that I say...Welcome to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Was there 4 times last year and had never had a problem”
Reviews.Author: PanamaFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am kind of new to the writing hotel reviews world, but since reviews have helped me in the past at the time I needed to decide which hotel to choose, I think it would only be fair to return the favor. I had stayed at the La Quinta Inn Airport North 5 times since last year and I am happy to report, I had no issues whatsoever. It is undertadable that there are moments when "stuff" happens, and that will definitely have an impact on your stay, but we have to be fair when we rate the hotel and when we rate the experience. This hotel is located in Doral. This is more of a business area and an ideal location for the overnight traveler. It has a Wendy's, McDonald's and Denny's, all at walking distance (3 to 5 min.) and also a small shopping plaza that has a Subway's and two restaurants (cuban and chinese). Miami International Mall and Dolphin Mall are between a 15 to 20 minute drive away, depending on the traffic. The hotel has a pool (that I have never used) that looks very clean. The rooms are very comfy. Two queen beds, TV, coffee maker, blow dryer, etc. If you are looking to stay on a fancy place, this may not be it. It's good and clean, but not fancy. And the are, as I mentioned, is more business oriented, so don't expect bars or discos nearby. If that's what you are looking for, then I suggest staying near SoBe or Coconut Groove. I will be back there on October 28. This is one of those hotels that, if you know what to expect, you chose with your eyes closed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, But No Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: ROWM2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night. The frontdesk associates were very nice. The complimentary continental breakfast was ok too. However, when I tried to take a shower, the water never got hot. I tried running the water in the sink for 10 min., and still didn't get hot. I ended up taking a sponge bath, but heating water in the 4cup coffee pot. I called the front desk, they said they would contact maintenance. No came. I went to the front desk, still no one came. The sad part is that no one made an offer to let me shower in another room, or even some type of compensation for my inconvenience. I'm sure it's not like this all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover. The rooms are very nice.”
Reviews.Author: TotalRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Having read decent reviews, I was a bit disappointed when I first pulled up, as all of the rooms opened to the outside like a typical motel, not interior entries like a hotel. It looks like this used to be some other kind of property and must have been converted. The color of the buildings is just butt ugly and the chain link fence around the parking lot does not look inviting. Makes you worry about the neighborhood. In any event, I walked into the lobby and was pleasantly surprised, as it was fresh, clean, attractive, and modern. When I got to my room, I was even more surprised. There was a bottle of water and a cookie waiting for me. The interior of the room was beautiful! The furniture was modern, the paint fresh, the decor quite pretty. And the bed was oh so comfortable. It was not at all what I would have expected from just looking at the exterior. The only problem I had was trying to find the ice machine. It is up on the second floor and quite hidden. Even though the clerk told me where it was, I spent a good 10-15 minutes on the hunt, plus going back & forth, as it was a long way from my room. Breakfast was ok, but nothing to write home about. They did not have the "make your own waffles" that you usually find at LaQuinta. These were toaster waffles, no thanks. There was a McDonalds next door and a Dennys next to it, so you could walk to either one. Overall, I thought it was a good value for a hotel located close to the airport. It was quiet in my room, too.

Reviews.Title: “A++ AGAIN AND AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: EDWINMBC
Reviews.Content: this was the fourth time in this hotel and it was the same great, nice, clean safe room great people at the hotel great beds, everything was a++, only had a little problem with the internet but i used every day., becouse i am a gold member i could check out an hour later. thanks, and the breakfast was very good too

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAtraveller3
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of proximity to airport as we had very early flight to catch. Easily accessible from motorways.Rooms are large and pleasantly decorated. Bathrooms clean and neat. Carpets had a bit of a funny damp smell but i can only assume its because of the humidity and cleaning stuff they use.Staff were all very pleasant and went out of their way to be helpful.Would defntly stay there again if required.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: zaneopal
Reviews.Content: The personnel was very friendly and accommodating. We forgot to ask for a roll-away bed at check-in, but they sent one up to us in short order. It was probably ten minutes from the time we called to the time they brought it up, and a manager stopped by later to make sure it had been delivered. This was a good hotel for our purposes (my friends and I made the trip down to Miami to go to the Orange Bowl), and considering we were four college students on a budget, we felt like we got a good hotel for the price we paid. The bathroom had no fan, so it was very humid if someone took a shower, and our TV started to go on the fritz the second of the two nights we were there, but other than that, we had no major issues.

Reviews.Title: “No major problems”
Reviews.Author: ostan14
Reviews.Content: Didn't find this motel too bad at all. We sort of stumbled upon this motel as we were looking for airport and getting hopelessly lost. Got a great walk in rate - eventually. I say eventually as the most unhelpful receptionist - Leida?? - could not say at 2.30 pm if she had any rooms available. Told us to come back at 3.00pm. Surely she would have an idea, and there was no need to be so abrupt and cold. The room was fine, clean, newly refurbished but unfortunately lacked a fridge, which is something we had come to expect on our trip. We ended up staying a second night, but our room was not serviced the second day. Not a major problem, but again unnecessary. There is WiFi, but would only work in lobby - maybe our block was too far to pick up signal. If this property could sort out their staff, it would greatly improve the guest experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go Here”
Reviews.Author: ekievit
Reviews.Content: Allthough i have very good memories with several La Quinta's Do not go here. This is a very old property,we had a dirty- and smelly room. Very unfriendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: sunNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is a older hotel located in a unsafe area in Miami. The shuttle took over an hour to pick us up from airport. We were given a room near the back of the property, and noticed people just hanging around the rear of the property. The room smelled of mildew and the elevator barely worked.

Reviews.Title: “not the best MIA LaQuinta”
Reviews.Author: AuroraVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February overnighting between flights. I wanted to try it because it was a little cheaper than the other two LaQuintas. There was one employee there, trying to check in a vanful of people, and it took over a half hour to check in. The room was clean enough, but didn't have the amenity basket that I have seen at the newer MIA LaQuintas. There are a couple restaurants next door in the shopping plaza that are safe to walk to. Otherwise, yes you are getting an older motel for the lower price. You do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuyFromSC
Reviews.Content: This is an aging hotel, with years of wear and tear evident in everything from the bathroom floor to the carpet. I was staying at the La Quinta on business, having flown into MIA and working nearby. The location was convenient for me as I had stayed at a nearby hotel a few weeks prior. On checking in I was surprised to note that all rooms open to the outside. Not a major issue for me, but maybe a little unnerving to someone with security issues. The choices on cable were limited at best (no FNC...I hate it when Fox News Channel is censored). Bed sheets were well worn. I went to bed early and was awakened at 9:45 p.m. by someone opening my door with a key. This is one of those places where you have an actual key, not a key card. I yelled and the person went away very quickly. When I told the front desk what had happened, they said, "Oh, I'm sorry. I'll check with housekeeping and see what is going on." I'm not the kind of person that needs groveling, but the apology was on the order of what I would expect if they had been a little late with an extra set of towels. I never did hear what happened, and I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: debihen
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, convenient. Front desk very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service & Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: SBH0078
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The service was wonderful. I am from Miami and went for a friends wedding. The customer service we received was great, I can't say enough about how nice everyone was. The room was very clean and the area is a nice area for the price. It is pretty centrally located right off of the Palmetto Expressway. I would def. stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, Stay away, old and bad area”
Reviews.Author: travelpiggy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night because the LQ North near MIA was full. I wanted to pick a hotel which was close to the airport because we had an early morning flight. I wish I had picked a different hotel. I'm a LQ Returns Rewards member and this was not a Tier 3 hotel by any stretch of the imagination. The rooms may have recently been renovated but the hotel is still very old and our room had a certain overly powering musty smell. Location: This LQ is located on the North West corner of the airport. I felt the area was not the nicest in Miami. There's a McDonalds next door and 2 Shell Gas stations just down the block. The 826 Hwy is just one block to the right. Room: We had a king size room on the 2nd floor. The room appeared recently renovated but there was an old strong smell to it and the bathrooms did not look renovated. The towels were thin but that's pretty standard with other LQs. The bed was sufficiently firm and clean. I would not recommend this hotel for any families with kids. Our room overlooking the pool. However, we did not venture into the pool. From what we could see it was a fairly standard pool but there were leafs in the water. It didn't look appealing. Service: I was unable to connect to the wireless network from my room. I needed to walk down to the lobby to successfully connect. After establishing a connection, the internet speed was sufficient to check into my flight. Breakfast: The selection was less than the typical LQ breakfast. This LQ served cereal, yogurt, toast & bagel, apples, and juice. It was missing the typical oatmeal and hard boiled egg. Bottomline: I would not recommend staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Camera_Boy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the day before our cruise and on the day we returned. The rooms were clean and the staff was helpful. Some of the other reviews I have read about this place made it sound like a horror show. It is far from that! It isn't the Ritz Carlton but you aren't paying for the Ritz. The hotel has been recently renovated and you could tell the upgrades that have been made. The only real beef I have about the hotel is the location. You have to take a taxi everywhere; if you want to shop, a decent place to eat, sites to visit, but that wasn't why I choose this hotel. It is close to the airport and they pick you up and drop you off at Miami International. They have a courtesy phone at the airport and it was easy to get into contact once we arrived. The traffic in Miami is horrible, but they picked us up in a fairly timely fashion. The breakfast is a bit on the Spartan side, but enough to get you through 'til lunch. All in all, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, nasty, stay far away”
Reviews.Author: karrose
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin, room was not cleaned, hair in bed, hair in bath tub. Toliet was dirty I had to clean with the 1 and only hand towel so my son could use it. the coffee pot had coffee splilled down the side, carpet was clearly not vaccumed room stunk of mold. We spent most of the day with the door open spraying air freshner, begging for bedding which the maid and her boss argured that our room wasn't on the list to clean. I had to make my own bed, NO TOLIET PAPER waited all day for that too. At 9pm it became impossible to stay in room with door shut do to mold smell i phone 1-800 complain La Quinta I then booked a room at the Sleep Inn and checked out at 9:10pm. I have talked to the Manager and I too have been refunded. See attched pic's YUCK

Reviews.Title: “this place is the pits”
Reviews.Author: pineview8850
Reviews.Content: First night, Saturday was okay...... Sunday night we found that the bed was miserably uncomfortable. Come to find out that when they cleaned our room they had removed the mattress cover. Just a bare sheet between us and a very used mattress. They say the renovated. A paint job doesn't constitute renovations in my mind. My husband could not sit on the edge of the bed to put on clothes because of the obvious hole or low spot in the cheap mattress. Also, our bathroom stunk of mold and mildew. Our phone had a message light illuminated and although we had no messages, two calls to the front desk went without resolution. Apparently no one knew how to fix it so we had to put the phone on the floor and cover it with clothes for two nights to keep it from shining in our face. Returned late on Monday and found at 4 pm our room had not yet been cleaned. Filthy from being out in the everglades we were furious that we had to track someone down to get clean towels so we could take a shower and leave for dinner. While bathing we heard them come to clean the room but they were locked out for obvious reasons. We called the hotel mgmt and told them we'd be gone an hour for dinner and we expected someone to get up there and demanded our room be cleaned. Came back to find the bed made, no vacumming whatsoever, and 2 towels. No hand towels no wash clothes. and still no mattress cover. At this point we were furious and called the front desk demanding a mattress cover and wash clothes. We were called back a couple of minutes later by a woman who said that they didn't have any wash clothes, all of them had been stolen and they were on order. At this point I lost it......stealing towels I've heard of but not the washclothes. Within 10 minutes another employee showed up with towels, hand towels, and wash clothes. She also put a mattress pad on the bed. The next morning as we got up to leave we realized that our pocket size Nikon Digital camera was gone. We tore the room apart looking for it. In our furor I had mistakenly left it on the dresser when we left for dinner the previous night and called thenm for cleaning service. All of our Miami pictures were now gone. Fortunately I had been downloading all of our other 3 weeks of vacation onto my laptap which was hidden in the room. The front desk clerk reversed one night stay for our trouble. As I pointed out that doesn't do me any good regarding my camera. Only after I filed a complaint online with LA Quinta corp. (who never did respond) did I hear from the actual manager. He reversed the rest of the charges and when he heard I was seeking to find out if my travelers insurance would cover the loss of the camera he offered to pay any difference. Needless to say it didn't meet my homeowners deductible and travelers wouldn't cover it. I notified the manager via fax that I was going to have to bear the full cost of the camera and haven't heard a word since. The place is despicable and having been a long time fan of La Quinta I can say this one 3 day stay has soured me from ever staying at a LA Quinta Inn again. I wish I had known about Trip Advisor before this trip. Had I read the reviews I would have never stayed there in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of service problems”
Reviews.Author: TerryNA
Reviews.Content: The problems started when I waited 35 minutes for a van from the airport. I told the receptionist I was waiting at Terminal E. Four phone calls later, I still hadn't found the van, even though it had allegedly been there for 10 minutes. I finally located him in front of Terminal D! It took him 14 min. to drive to the hotel, a rather long time for an "airport" hotel. Then, when I got to the hotel and asked about a ride back to the airport the next morning, I was told that the first van left at 6 AM. This could have been fairly tight for my 7:35 AM flight, and it would have been downright dangerous for any flight leaving before 7 AM. Seems that a property that bills itself as an "airport" hotel should have transportation to meet flights that leave as early as 6 AM. After leaving for my connecting flight, I soon realized that I had left a jacket and a belt in my room. I phoned the hotel and asked them to be on the lookout for them, and said that I would stop by on my return four days later to pick them up. Well, when I arrived four days later, the personnel at the desk had no knowledge of these items. I eventually got them to contact a supervisor, but this took 20 minutes! (Part of the delay was caused by a walkie-talkie whose battery was dead.) Meanwhile, people were waiting to be checked in. Some of them waited almost the whole 20 minutes. And one other guest was complaining about the lack of airport transportation before 6 AM. After all of this, they told me that they could not find my jacket, could not help me at all. Oh, with regard to the room, I have no major complaints. The floor of the bathtub was spongy, like there was an air pocket beneath it. Otherwise, the room was fine. But the service was not.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot understand all of the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: woodstocksez
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand the bad reviews of this hotel. Perhaps the hotel hadn't yet recovered from hurricane damage at the time the others stayed (one of the reviews alluded to something of the sort). We (me, wife and two toddler sons) stayed here for one night after a cross-country flight before heading to my parents' place on the Gulf Coast the next day. We had no problems at all with our room. It was nothing fancy (as you'd expect in this price range), but it was clean and at least as nice as I'd expect for the price, if not more so. We missed out on the continental breakfast, having slept in after being exhausted from the trip the day before (and, in my case, more particularly, from not having slept the night before). I was a little bummed because the lobby/dining area looked quite charming; I had been hoping to hang there for a while before we got on with our day (took in a Marlins game before driving across the state). We also had no problem with the front desk staff. In fact, far from being difficult or surly, I actually thought the front desk staff was noticeably more friendly and helpful than typical hotel front desk staff. The hotel is along a main thoroughfare and there are a number of fast food and low budget restaurants nearby. It's also, obviously, close to the airport, making it a convenient place to stay for purposes such as ours. I don't know if I'd want to spend a week here, but for a night or two, we found this hotel to be an above-average value.

Reviews.Title: “A total dump... Shouldn't have a La Quinta sign outside”
Reviews.Author: isho21
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal La Quinta patron because of its value for money. I always know that for $100 per night I will get a clean, decent room. NOT the case at Airport North. This place is a total dump. The dilapidaded building hasn't had any maintenance or upkeep in years. As soon as I checked into the room, I immediately called La Quinta's 1-800 number to complain and ask them to move me. They said that even if they could move me to another La Quinta (which they couldn't even look up, I'd have to drive over and see if I could get a room) I would pay for my room at both hotels since I had already checked in. The entire hotel reeks of old mildew. The bathroom in my room actually had two brown stains on the toilet seat, which I had to disgustingly wipe off (not saying it was poop, but it might have been). The neighborhood is dreadful and I generally felt unsafe even walking around there. Not only will I never stay at this hotel again, I will never stay at La Quinta again because of this awful experience. I can't believe they even dare put the La Quinta stamp on this place because it doesn't even beat your average run-down $49 motel. Absolutely awful.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: genner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was unbearable. Our first room was not clean - the bed had lots of hairs in it and a table was covered in spills. Clearly, it had not been cleaned. When we requested another room, we were moved to a room that had a large window that would not close or lock - meaning someone could easily get into our room at any time. Since we felt unsafe, we asked for another room. The third room was still not clean. The water from the tap was brown. The floor was not vacuumed. We stayed but I could not wait to leave. I will never stay at La Quinta again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this room because it was close to the airport & has wireless internet in all the rooms. The wireless internet worked well, but that's the only nice thing I can say about this place. The room was disgusting. There were used Q-tips behind the bed & under the table. The bathroom had someone else's hair all over the sink. I picked up the alarm clock to set it and a mysterious liquid that was underneath it dripped all over my hand & arm. The pillows reeked of cheap perfume, which made it difficult to sleep. The coffee maker was missing the coffee pot. There were people going in and out of rooms all night & making a lot of noise. The sheets had old stains on them & the room smelled like cat urine. We didn't get a do not disturb sign and the maid woke us up at 9am. Plus the area is not nice - there is a gun store rght next door. There are plenty of other places to stay near the MIA airport - don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Illy1108
Reviews.Content: Got this room for $52 through Priceline. I am originally from Miami and my company is based in the direct area, so staying at this hotel was great as far as location is concerned...next to all the major expressways, close to food, entertainment, etc. Unfortunately, this is the best comment I can make about this hotel. They are still recovering (a yr later?) from hurricane Wilma and more than half the rooms are not in service. The rooms themselves were fine, standard rooms. We did detect a slight mildew smell due to the water leakage but could not see any signs of water damage. We could not get extra pillows the first night of our stay and had to beg the housekeeper for them the next day. Our room was not made up the next day, although we left the room before 1pm. When we complained, we were given extra towls. Next day I called the front desk AGAIN to make sure our room was made. When we came home that night, only the bed and the towels had been touched, nothing else. The garbage was piled up, the carpet had not been vacuumed, the mirror in the bathroom was gross, no toilet paper; in other words, only the bare minimum had been done. We complained again. The GM gave us a refund of two nights, which we are still waiting for from Priceline. Another problem was check in. The young lady assured us that there were no pay per view movies and would not need to swipe our credit card. When we got to the room and saw that there WERE movies, we tried to order and had to go to the front desk at 12 midnight to have our card swiped then. Last warning: there is a night club in the strip mall next door that provides a hangout for a lot of younger adults. I saw a lot of those patrons renting rooms as soon as they left the nightclub, if you know what I mean. They were using it as a motel; I saw most of these rooms being dis-occupied within a few hours after they had checked in. Not a great place to have your kids. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience I've Had”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews posted so far give an accurate description of the less than impressive property (the pool / hot tub is the best part), and the indifferent, defensive staff that we were forced to deal with when, after returning from dinner, we discovered that our room had been broken into and many of our things stolen. The front desk staff was so unaccommodating and unresponsive that they made us feel as if the theft were our fault. Despite the fact that we filed an official report with the police, contacted La Quinta coprorate headquarters, and followed up with legal filings, we were not compensated for anything. I was surprised to learn that one of the previous customers receieved a voucher for a free night due to service complaints -- not only did we have to pay for our stay that night, we were not offered any alternative compensation. Not that a free night would have made any difference - we will never stay at a La Quinta property again.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy the smell of Mildew...this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well we got there pretty late at night after a flight from Toronto Canada. We took their shuttle from the airport to the hotel and I would say DO NOT EVER take their shuttle. The male driver flew down the roads hitting the gas and brake simultaneously and was cutting in and out of traffic. I thought I was going to die. So once we get to the place the front desk agent was very nice and informative. We walk to our room passing the pool and seeing leaves and other floating stuff in it. Honestly who knows when the last time it was cleaned?!? So we now enter the room and a strong musty mildewy smell hits us and almost makes us pass out. The room was very plain and had nothing special to it. The bathroom was great...clean to the eye and very spacious...just what four girlz need. So it's been 10 months since I'd seen my sister and mom and we wanted to go out and have some drinks as this trip was for my 21st birthday. Yeah it is the sketchiest neighbour hood EVER!!! We were told to go next door to this apparent club. If you're into clubs that have metal doors with no windows to see in then that is the place for you. There is nothing around this hotel.. no good food places..no pubs to relax in...NOTHING!!! So we ask the front desk agent where a nice pub is and she tells us about one and it was great but a ways away. The next morning my mother and I went to see what was for breakfast and it was nothing fancy by any means. Individually wrapped bagels and danishes with yogurt and milk. It was nice but definetly not worth what the room cost. If you are looking for a budget place and enjoy being scared to walk down the street late at night this is the place for you if not go elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Creepy - Last Resort Only”
Reviews.Author: texmln
Reviews.Content: We were trapped at the Miami airport and had to find a room late at night (11pm) to overnight in. We called the "motel" from the reservation board located in the baggage claim. The rate was outrageous at $125 a night but still much cheaper than several other hotels so I knew I might be in for a rough night. Though the motel claims to be "only 1 mile" from the airport what they really mean is they are 1 mile from the edge of airport property, being about as far away from the main terminal as possible while still able to make this claim. The cab ride is $14. When we pulled up the entryway light was flickering on and off revealing a passed out security guard laying on a baggage cart in front of a well-worn motel. The night clerk checked us in quickly and sent us to our room, which had a mildewy stench. The kind of smell that says you will wake up with a sore throat just from breathing the air. On the plus side, though I was expecting a nasty, dirty room the sheets were clean and the bathroom was fairly clean as well. The room is about as basic as they come. Nonetheless, this motel is located in an area that does not make one feel safe. I would not recommend staying at this motel unless you have no other option and want to be close to the airport.
